Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Odorranain-C1 (OdC1, natural AMPs; frog, amphibians, animals; XXU; 1S=S, UCSS1a)

Literature Information.Literature: Activity: active against E. coli ATCC 35150 or ATCC 10305 (MIC 8.2-12 ug/ml), S. aureus ATCC 25923 (MIC 4.1-10 ug/ml), B. subtilis (MIC 12-16.4 ug/ml), L. monocytogenes ATCC 21633 (MIC 10 ug/ml), and C. albicans (MIC 2.1 ug/ml). Combined with activity data analyzed using recombinant OdC1 (see Li et al., 2024 below).MOA:bacteria:S. aureus: permeabilized bacterial membranes.In vitro toxicity: not hemo-lytic at 50 ug/ml.Recombinant production:yeast:Pichia pastoris: peptide expression reached peak value (1405 ng/ml) at day 5 (Li et al., 2024).Food protection: the recombinant peptide was able to extend the shelf life of Tilapia fillets by two days.Updated 5/2020; 7/2021; 5/2024
Literature Information.Author: Li J, Xu X, Xu C, Zhou W, Zhang K, Yu H, Zhang Y, Zheng Y, Rees HH, Lai R, Yang D, Wu J.2007
Literature Information.Title: Anti-infection peptidomics of amphibian skin
